  "description": "KPMG is a global network of independent professional services firm with deep expertise in the provision of audit, tax and advisory services to clients in various industries and sectors of the economy. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Tax Technical Desk Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Division: Tax Regulatory and People Services (TRPS)
Reports To: Partner &amp; Head of Tax

Job Description


	The Tax Technical Desk (TD) Manager will be responsible for driving technical excellence, knowledge management, and advocacy initiatives within the Tax Division.
	The role requires strong technical expertise in Nigerian and international tax laws, as well as excellent writing and research skills, and the ability to deliver impactful training programs.
	The TD Manager will lead the preparation of newsletters, technical alerts, and publications; coordinate internal and external tax training sessions; and spearhead advocacy initiatives on behalf of the firm, including reviews and recommendations on proposed tax and regulatory policies and legislation.


Key Responsibilities
Technical Research &amp; Advisory:


	Conduct comprehensive research and analysis on Nigerian tax and regulatory policies, legislation, treaties, tax circulars, case laws, and other relevant Acts.
	Provide expert guidance and opinions on complex tax matters to internal teams and clients.
	Monitor local and international tax developments (e.g., OECD, BEPS, Pillars 1 &amp; 2) and assess local implications.


Regulatory Updates, Publications &amp; Thought Leadership:


	Draft, review, and disseminate high-quality newsletters, tax alerts, and technical papers on regulatory updates.
	Develop thought leadership materials to position the firm as an authority on tax and fiscal policy.
	Manage a tax knowledge repository with accessible technical resources and precedents.


Training &amp; Knowledge Management:


	Design, lead, and coordinate weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly technical sessions for TRPS.
	Deliver internal and external training sessions to enhance technical competence across the firm and with clients.
	Develop training materials, case studies, and knowledge-sharing tools for continuous professional development.


Advocacy &amp; Policy Engagement:


	Lead the firm&rsquo;s advocacy initiatives with regulators, legislators, and industry groups.
	Review draft tax laws, regulations, and policy papers, and prepare position papers on behalf of the firm.
	Represent the firm at technical committees, consultations, and professional body engagements (e.g., CITN, ICAN, NESG).
	Work closely with the Partner &amp; Head of Tax to anticipate and address potential regulatory challenges.


Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of Second Class (upper division) Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree from an accredited university.
	Minimum of 9 years of tax experience, with at least 3 years in a tax technical, knowledge management, or training-focused role.
	Professional qualification: ACA, ACCA, CITN, or equivalent.


Proven experience in:


	Writing technical newsletters, alerts, or articles.
	Designing and delivering training programs (internal and external).
	Engaging in tax advocacy or policy review initiatives.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong people management and development skills.
	Excellent facilitation and presentation skills.
	Excellent analytical, research, and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and commitment to quality.

Tax Technical Desk Manager Job at KPMG




        
    

        
        KPMG is a global network of independent professional services firm with deep expertise in the provision of audit, tax and advisory services to clients in various industries and sectors of the economy. The Firm is well represented in Nigeria and across the African continent, with the objective of providing exceptional and quality services to multinational, regional and local clients and to enhance the product offerings in certain previously under-serviced markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax Technical Desk Manager

Job Location: Nigeria
Division: Tax Regulatory and People Services (TRPS)
Reports To: Partner & Head of Tax

Job Description


	The Tax Technical Desk (TD) Manager will be responsible for driving technical excellence, knowledge management, and advocacy initiatives within the Tax Division.
	The role requires strong technical expertise in Nigerian and international tax laws, as well as excellent writing and research skills, and the ability to deliver impactful training programs.
	The TD Manager will lead the preparation of newsletters, technical alerts, and publications; coordinate internal and external tax training sessions; and spearhead advocacy initiatives on behalf of the firm, including reviews and recommendations on proposed tax and regulatory policies and legislation.


Key Responsibilities
Technical Research & Advisory:


	Conduct comprehensive research and analysis on Nigerian tax and regulatory policies, legislation, treaties, tax circulars, case laws, and other relevant Acts.
	Provide expert guidance and opinions on complex tax matters to internal teams and clients.
	Monitor local and international tax developments (e.g., OECD, BEPS, Pillars 1 & 2) and assess local implications.


Regulatory Updates, Publications & Thought Leadership:


	Draft, review, and disseminate high-quality newsletters, tax alerts, and technical papers on regulatory updates.
	Develop thought leadership materials to position the firm as an authority on tax and fiscal policy.
	Manage a tax knowledge repository with accessible technical resources and precedents.


Training & Knowledge Management:


	Design, lead, and coordinate weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly technical sessions for TRPS.
	Deliver internal and external training sessions to enhance technical competence across the firm and with clients.
	Develop training materials, case studies, and knowledge-sharing tools for continuous professional development.


Advocacy & Policy Engagement:


	Lead the firm’s advocacy initiatives with regulators, legislators, and industry groups.

title: Job Openings at Updeal Resources
content:
Updeal Resources - Our client in various sectors are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) HR / Secretarial Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
Human Resources Functions:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Talent Acquisition & Onboarding: Manage end-to-end recruitment, selection, and onboarding to attract and retain top talent.
	Workforce Management: Maintain employee records, oversee staff deployment, and ensure optimal workforce utilization.
	Employee Engagement: Design and implement initiatives that enhance employee satisfaction, collaboration, and workplace culture.
	Learning & Development: Develop and monitor training programs to support professional growth and organizational capability.
	Performance Management: Coordinate the appraisal process, ensuring fairness, transparency, and alignment with business goals.
	Exit Management: Oversee offboarding, conduct exit interviews, and provide insights for retention strategies.


Legal & Compliance Functions:


	Draft, review, and update employment contracts, HR policies, and legal documents.
	Provide legal guidance on employee relations, disciplinary processes, and dispute resolution.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, employment regulations, and company policies.
	Conduct compliance checks and support internal investigations when necessary.


Corporate & Regulatory Functions:


	Interface with regulatory bodies (e.g., CBN, PENCOM, ITF, NSITF, and tax authorities) to ensure compliance with statutory obligations.
	CAC Processing & Secretarial Services: Handle corporate filings, company secretarial duties, board resolutions, statutory returns, and other CAC-related documentation.
	Support corporate governance by maintaining statutory records and ensuring timely submission of regulatory filings.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: updealcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Internal Audit Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Summary


	The Internal Auditor is responsible for providing independent assurance on the Bank’s risk management, control, and governance processes.


Responsibilities
Key responsibilities include:


	Audit Planning & Execution: Develop annual audit plans, conduct risk-based audits across financial, operational, and compliance areas, and verify accuracy of records and transactions.
	Control Evaluation & Risk Management: Assess adequacy of process design and effectiveness of internal controls, identify weaknesses, and recommend practical improvements.
	Reporting & Advisory: Prepare clear audit reports, present findings to management and the Audit Committee, and provide independent advice to support corporate objectives.
	Compliance Monitoring: Ensure adherence to internal policies and regulatory requirements, keeping abreast of industry and regulatory changes.
	Fraud Detection & Investigation: Investigate suspected fraud or irregularities, recommend preventive measures, and support anti-fraud initiatives.
	Follow-up & Process Improvement: Monitor implementation of audit recommendations, promote efficiency in business processes, and safeguard the Bank’s assets.
	Other Duties: Perform additional audit-related responsibilities as may be assigned by Management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Proven experience as an Internal auditor in a Microfinance Bank is a must.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Familiarity with industry regulations and compliance standards.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: updealcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Chief Marketing Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with the bank’s business goals.
	Lead brand development, positioning, and communications strategies across all channels.
	Oversee market research and analysis to identify growth opportunities and trends.
	Drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention through targeted campaigns.
	Manage digital and traditional marketing efforts including social media, PR, advertising, and events.
	Collaborate cross-functionally with product, sales, and operations to ensure alignment.
	Build and mentor a high-performing marketing team.
	Monitor KPIs and ROI of marketing initiatives and optimize performance accordingly.
	Champion innovation in marketing technology and data-driven decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field (MBA orprofessional marketing certification is a plus).
	Minimum of 7 years of progressive marketing experience, with at least 3 years in a leadership/executive role within the financial services, microfinance.
	Strong understanding of the Nigerian financial market and customer behavior.
	Proven track record of brand building, digital transformation, and marketing-led growth.
	Exceptional leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Analytical mindset with a data-driven approach to marketing.
	Experience in customer segmentation, campaign management, and CRM systems.


What We Offer


	Competitive executive remuneration and performance-based incentives.
	A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
	Opportunity to shape the future of microfinance in Nigeria.
	Professional growth and leadership development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: updealcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Business Partner

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (O-site)
Category: Marketing & Communications

Description
We are the place for you, if:

	You are ready to work extremely hard, at a fast pace, to achieve audacious goals. You love to speak up, ask questions and are comfortable challenging anyone or any idea.


The Position


	As a Compliance Business Partner, you will provide guidance and support to the Legal & Compliance department on compliance and other related matters and ensure the company’s compliance with all regulatory and statutory obligations/requirements

	Pension contributions and other statutory benefits.

  "description": "Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.&nbsp; Greenlight&rsquo;s Sun King&trade; products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Associate Manager, Corporate Finance

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Reporting To: Sr. Manager - Investor Relations
Department: Finance &amp; Legal

About The Role


	Sun King is looking for a Corporate Finance Associate Manager, to join its Finance team in Nigeria.
	The Corporate Finance Associate will provide both operational and strategic support to the organization by supporting the senior management in all strategic and tactical matters relating to corporate finance activities including but not limited to Financial model, forecasting, compilation of documents required for covenant reporting, debt raising and investors requirements.


Responsibilities
Debt Financing &amp; Investor Relations:


	Manage existing debt investor relationships and support in identifying new funding opportunities.
	Liaise with senior management of potential debt investors for fundraising initiatives.
	Participate in debt terms negotiations, documentation, and compliance monitoring.
	Lead due diligence processes for fundraising activities.
	Handle post-drawdown reporting and covenant management.


Financial Modelling &amp; Analysis:


	Develop, maintain, and analyze financial and valuation models.
	Provide insights and recommendations on financial performance, investment opportunities, and risk.
	Support corporate finance strategy including securitization and debt structuring.


Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Prepare financial documents, reports, investor presentations, and proposals using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI.
	Compile and maintain electronic data rooms for fundraising projects.
	Deliver periodic reports on financial covenants and fundraising progress.


Risk &amp; Compliance Management:


	Monitor forex exposures and implement risk mitigation through hedging strategies.
	Ensure compliance with financial covenants and reporting requirements.
	Support grant management and related reporting.


Strategic Advisory &amp; Projects:


	Provide ad hoc support on M&amp;A deals, corporate restructuring, and potential IPO initiatives.
	Partner with internal teams to align on financial strategies and fundraising objectives.
	Assist the Senior Manager, Investor Relations in all strategic investor-facing activities.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	Have Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or its equivalent in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in corporate finance, impact funding, financial services or investment banking.
	Professional qualification ICAN required; ACCA/CFA is a strong advantage).
	Proven skills in financial modelling, debt financing, and investor relations.
	Solid knowledge of profit &amp; loss reporting, fundraising, and securitization.
	Good writing and presentation skills with full proficiency in Microsoft Office and analytics tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI).
	Experience with financial reporting, covenant management, and due diligence processes.
	Highly analytical with good level of attention to detail.
	Self-motivated and able to work without supervision.
	Excellent people, listening, and negotiation skills.
	Adaptable to a fast-paced, multicultural work environment.
	Willingness to travel frequently.

Associate Manager, Corporate Finance Job at Greenlight Planet




        
    

        
        Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Greenlight’s Sun King™ products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Associate Manager, Corporate Finance
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Reporting To: Sr. Manager - Investor Relations
Department: Finance & Legal

About The Role


	Sun King is looking for a Corporate Finance Associate Manager, to join its Finance team in Nigeria.
	The Corporate Finance Associate will provide both operational and strategic support to the organization by supporting the senior management in all strategic and tactical matters relating to corporate finance activities including but not limited to Financial model, forecasting, compilation of documents required for covenant reporting, debt raising and investors requirements.


Responsibilities
Debt Financing & Investor Relations:


	Manage existing debt investor relationships and support in identifying new funding opportunities.
	Liaise with senior management of potential debt investors for fundraising initiatives.
	Participate in debt terms negotiations, documentation, and compliance monitoring.
	Lead due diligence processes for fundraising activities.
	Handle post-drawdown reporting and covenant management.


Financial Modelling & Analysis:


	Develop, maintain, and analyze financial and valuation models.
	Provide insights and recommendations on financial performance, investment opportunities, and risk.
	Support corporate finance strategy including securitization and debt structuring.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Prepare financial documents, reports, investor presentations, and proposals using MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI.
	Compile and maintain electronic data rooms for fundraising projects.
	Deliver periodic reports on financial covenants and fundraising progress.


Risk & Compliance Management:


	Monitor forex exposures and implement risk mitigation through hedging strategies.
	Ensure compliance with financial covenants and reporting requirements.
	Support grant management and related reporting.


Strategic Advisory & Projects:


	Provide ad hoc support on M&A deals, corporate restructuring, and potential IPO initiatives.
	Partner with internal teams to align on financial strategies and fundraising objectives.
	Assist the Senior Manager, Investor Relations in all strategic investor-facing activities.


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	Have Bachelor’s Degree or its equivalent in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in corporate finance, impact funding, financial services or investment banking.
	Professional qualification ICAN required; ACCA/CFA is a strong advantage).
	Proven skills in financial modelling, debt financing, and investor relations.
	Solid knowledge of profit & loss reporting, fundraising, and securitization.
	Good writing and presentation skills with full proficiency in Microsoft Office and analytics tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI).
	Experience with financial reporting, covenant management, and due diligence processes.
	Highly analytical with good level of attention to detail.
	Self-motivated and able to work without supervision.
	Excellent people, listening, and negotiation skills.
	Adaptable to a fast-paced, multicultural work environment.
	Willingness to travel frequently.
